attributes.action: Urgent plea - make the cost of neutering/spaying cats more affordable to all
attributes.additional_details:
cats can reproduce numerous times during their lifetime 
Assuming a cat has 3 litters per year, and in each litter they have 6 kittens, the following shows how 1 cat turns into 10077696 over a 12 year period.

1 cat x  3 x 6 x 12 years = 216 kittens 
216 cats 3 x 6 x 12 years =  46,656 Kittens
46,656 cats x 3 x 6 x 12 years = 100,77,696 
These figures are shocking. 
Thousands of these will be euthanised, abandoned or suffer horrifically at the hands of evil humans.
attributes.background:
Animal rescues and sanctuaries are overrun with unwanted kittens and cats.  Some of the rescue centres only home the cats for a certain length of time before they have to be euthanised.
food, cat litter, cleaning products, vaccinations etc cost £100s and rescues rely on donations and volunteers.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could start a new petition asking Government and Parliament to provide funding to animal charities to neuter or spay cats, if that what you'd like to happen.
